titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Garrit S.K. Remsen bankbook 1973.175
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:11:23 +0000.

did.abstract: One bankbook issued by National City Bank of Brooklyn to Collector Garrit S.K. Remsen. The book includes records of financial transactions for the period 1889 to 1895.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Garrit S.K. Remsen, date unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1973.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Garrit S.K. Remsen bankbook, 1973.175, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Garrit (also spelled Garret) S.K. Remsen was Collector for School District No. 2 in the Brooklyn neighborhood of Flatlands.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One bankbook issued by National City Bank of Brooklyn to Collector Garrit S.K. Remsen. The book includes records of financial transactions for the period 1889 to 1895.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related archival collections at the Brooklyn Historical Society:

list.head: Missing Title
list.item: 1977.493, Garrit S.K. Remsen accounts for Flatlands School District No.2, 1894-1895
